member.name: T:AForge.IntPoint
member.summary: Structure for representing a pair of coordinates of integer type.

remarks.para: The structure is used to store a pair of integer coordinates.
Sample usage:

member.name: F:AForge.IntPoint.X
member.summary: X coordinate.

member.name: F:AForge.IntPoint.Y
member.summary: Y coordinate.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.DistanceTo(AForge.IntPoint)
member.summary: Calculate Euclidean distance between two points.
member.returns: Returns Euclidean distance between this point and points.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Addition(AForge.IntPoint,AForge.IntPoint)
member.summary: Addition operator - adds values of two points.
member.returns: Returns new point which coordinates equal to sum of corresponding coordinates of specified points.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Subtraction(AForge.IntPoint,AForge.IntPoint)
member.summary: Subtraction operator - subtracts values of two points.
member.returns: Returns new point which coordinates equal to difference of corresponding coordinates of specified points.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Addition(AForge.IntPoint,System.Int32)
member.summary: Addition operator - adds scalar to the specified point.
member.param: Value to add to coordinates of the specified point.
member.returns: Returns new point which coordinates equal to coordinates of the specified point increased by specified value.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Subtraction(AForge.IntPoint,System.Int32)
member.summary: Subtraction operator - subtracts scalar from the specified point.
member.param: Value to subtract from coordinates of the specified point.
member.returns: Returns new point which coordinates equal to coordinates of the specified point decreased by specified value.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Multiply(AForge.IntPoint,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplication operator - multiplies coordinates of the specified point by scalar value.
member.returns: Returns new point which coordinates equal to coordinates of the specified point multiplied by specified value.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Division(AForge.IntPoint,System.Int32)
member.summary: Division operator - divides coordinates of the specified point by scalar value.
member.returns: Returns new point which coordinates equal to coordinates of the specified point divided by specified value.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Equality(AForge.IntPoint,AForge.IntPoint)
member.summary: Equality operator - checks if two points have equal coordinates.
member.returns: Returns if coordinates of specified points are equal.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Inequality(AForge.IntPoint,AForge.IntPoint)
member.summary: Inequality operator - checks if two points have different coordinates.
member.returns: Returns if coordinates of specified points are not equal.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Check if this instance of equal to the specified one.
member.param: Another point to check equalty to.
member.returns: Return if objects are equal.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.GetHashCode
member.summary: Get hash code for this instance.
member.returns: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.op_Implicit(AForge.IntPoint)~AForge.DoublePoint
member.summary: Implicit conversion to .
member.param: Integer point to convert to double precision point.
member.returns: Returns new double precision point which coordinates are implicitly converted to doubles from coordinates of the specified integer point.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.ToString
member.summary: Get string representation of the class.
member.returns: Returns string, which contains values of the point in readable form.

member.name: M:AForge.IntPoint.EuclideanNorm
member.summary: Calculate Euclidean norm of the vector comprised of the point's coordinates - distance from (0, 0) in other words.
member.returns: Returns point's distance from (0, 0) point.

member.name: T:AForge.PolishExpression
member.summary: Evaluator of expressions written in reverse polish notation.

remarks.para: The class evaluates expressions writen in reverse postfix polish notation.
The list of supported functuins is:
Arguments for these functions could be as usual constants, written as numbers, as variables, writen as $<var_number> ($2, for example). The variable number is zero based index of variables array.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.PolishExpression.Evaluate(System.String,System.Double[])
member.summary: Evaluates specified expression.
member.param: Expression written in postfix polish notation.
member.returns: Evaluated value of the expression.
member.exception: Unsupported function is used in the expression.

member.name: T:AForge.DoubleRange
member.summary: Represents a double range with minimum and maximum values.

remarks.para: The class represents a double range with inclusive limits - both minimum and maximum values of the range are included into it. Mathematical notation of such range is [min, max].
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.DoubleRange.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.DoubleRange.IsInside(System.Double)
member.summary: Check if the specified value is inside of the range.
member.returns: True if the specified value is inside of the range or false otherwise.

member.name: M:AForge.DoubleRange.IsInside(AForge.DoubleRange)
member.summary: Check if the specified range is inside of the range.
member.returns: True if the specified range is inside of the range or false otherwise.

member.name: M:AForge.DoubleRange.IsOverlapping(AForge.DoubleRange)
member.summary: Check if the specified range overlaps with the range.
member.returns: True if the specified range overlaps with the range or false otherwise.

member.name: P:AForge.DoubleRange.Min
member.summary: Minimum value of the range.

remarks.para: The property represents minimum value (left side limit) or the range - [min, max].

member.name: P:AForge.DoubleRange.Max
member.summary: Maximum value of the range.

remarks.para: The property represents maximum value (right side limit) or the range - [min, max].

member.name: P:AForge.DoubleRange.Length
member.summary: Length of the range (deffirence between maximum and minimum values).

member.name: T:AForge.IntRange
member.summary: Represents an integer range with minimum and maximum values.

remarks.para: The class represents an integer range with inclusive limits - both minimum and maximum values of the range are included into it. Mathematical notation of such range is [min, max].
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.IntRange.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.IntRange.IsInside(System.Int32)
member.summary: Check if the specified value is inside of the range.
member.returns: True if the specified value is inside of the range or false otherwise.

member.name: M:AForge.IntRange.IsInside(AForge.IntRange)
member.summary: Check if the specified range is inside of the range.
member.returns: True if the specified range is inside of the range or false otherwise.

member.name: M:AForge.IntRange.IsOverlapping(AForge.IntRange)
member.summary: Check if the specified range overlaps with the range.
member.returns: True if the specified range overlaps with the range or false otherwise.

member.name: P:AForge.IntRange.Min
member.summary: Minimum value of the range.

remarks.para: The property represents minimum value (left side limit) or the range - [min, max].

member.name: P:AForge.IntRange.Max
member.summary: Maximum value of the range.

remarks.para: The property represents maximum value (right side limit) or the range - [min, max].

member.name: P:AForge.IntRange.Length
member.summary: Length of the range (deffirence between maximum and minimum values).

member.name: T:AForge.Parallel
member.summary: The class provides support for parallel computations, paralleling loop's iterations.

remarks.para: The class allows to parallel loop's iteration computing them in separate threads, what allows their simultaneous execution on multiple CPUs/cores.

member.name: M:AForge.Parallel.For(System.Int32,System.Int32,AForge.Parallel.ForLoopBody)
member.summary: Executes a for-loop in which iterations may run in parallel.

remarks.para: The method is used to parallel for-loop running its iterations in different threads. The start and stop parameters define loop's starting and ending loop's indexes. The number of iterations is equal to stop - start.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:AForge.Parallel.ThreadsCount
member.summary: Number of threads used for parallel computations.

remarks.para: The property sets how many worker threads are created for paralleling loops' computations.
By default the property is set to number of CPU's in the system (see ).

member.name: T:AForge.Parallel.ForLoopBody
member.summary: Delegate defining for-loop's body.

member.name: T:AForge.SystemTools
member.summary: Set of systems tools.

remarks.para: The class is a container of different system tools, which are used across the framework. Some of these tools are platform specific, so their implementation is different on different platform, like .NET and Mono.

member.name: M:AForge.SystemTools.CopyUnmanagedMemory(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy block of unmanaged memory.
member.returns: Return's value of - pointer to destination.

remarks.para: This function is required because of the fact that .NET does not provide any way to copy unmanaged blocks, but provides only methods to copy from unmanaged memory to managed memory and vise versa.

member.name: M:AForge.SystemTools.CopyUnmanagedMemory(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy block of unmanaged memory.
member.returns: Return's value of - pointer to destination.

remarks.para: This function is required because of the fact that .NET does not provide any way to copy unmanaged blocks, but provides only methods to copy from unmanaged memory to managed memory and vise versa.

member.name: M:AForge.SystemTools.SetUnmanagedMemory(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fill memory region with specified value.
member.returns: Return's value of - pointer to destination.

member.name: M:AForge.SystemTools.SetUnmanagedMemory(System.Byte*,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fill memory region with specified value.
member.returns: Return's value of - pointer to destination.

member.name: T:AForge.ConnectionFailedException
member.summary: Connection failed exception.

remarks.para: The exception is thrown in the case if connection to device has failed.

member.name: M:AForge.ConnectionFailedException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:AForge.ConnectionLostException
member.summary: Connection lost exception.

remarks.para: The exception is thrown in the case if connection to device is lost. When the exception is caught, user may need to reconnect to the device.

member.name: M:AForge.ConnectionLostException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:AForge.NotConnectedException
member.summary: Not connected exception.

remarks.para: The exception is thrown in the case if connection to device is not established, but user requests for its services.

member.name: M:AForge.NotConnectedException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.DoublePoint.op_Explicit(AForge.DoublePoint)~AForge.IntPoint
member.summary: Explicit conversion to .
member.param: Double precision point to convert to integer point.
member.returns: Returns new integer point which coordinates are explicitly converted to integers from coordinates of the specified double precision point by casting double values to integers value.

member.name: M:AForge.DoublePoint.Round
member.summary: Rounds the double precision point.
member.returns: Returns new integer point, which coordinates equal to whole numbers nearest to the corresponding coordinates of the double precision point.
